response_text: <rss version="2.0"><channel><ttl>60</ttl><title>Canada</title><link>http://www.nytimes.com/topic/destination/canada</link><description>World news about Canada. Breaking news and archival information about its people, politics and economy from The New York Times.</description><copyright>Copyright 2018 The New York Times Company</copyright><language>en-us</language><item><title>Canadian Olympic Success, a #MeToo Event and Saskatoon: The Canada Letter</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/16/world/canada/canadian-olympic-success-metoo-saskatoon-canada-letter.html</link><description>In this week’s Canada Letter a reporter at the Olympics takes questions about the country’s performance so far and we highlight a new landmark on the prairies.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:26:06 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>A Killing in Saskatchewan</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/15/opinion/colten-boushie-killing-saskatchewan.html</link><description>For Canada to mend its systemic inequalities, the country needs to first address its problem with racism against indigenous people.</description><author>By GABRIELLE SCRIMSHAW</author><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 00:44:22 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Transgender Woman Breast-Feeds Baby After Hospital Induces Lactation</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/15/health/transgender-woman-breast-feed.html</link><description>A journal says it’s the first documented case of successful inducement of breast-milk production in a transgender woman.</description><author>By CEYLAN YEGINSU</author><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 19:20:03 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Listen to ‘The Daily’: Trump’s Immigration Plan</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/15/podcasts/the-daily/trump-immigration-parkland-school-shooting.html</link><description>The president wants merit-based migration. But what counts as merit? We also report on the shooting at a Florida school in which at least 17 people died.</description><author>By MICHAEL BARBARO</author><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:29:25 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>In ‘Paradigm Shift,’ Trudeau Announces Talks on Indigenous People’s Rights</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/14/world/canada/trudeau-indigenous-peoples-rights.html</link><description>Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced talks on changing Canada’s legal system to guarantee Indigenous rights.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 01:17:03 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Canada Finds Itself in an Unusual Role: A Hockey Underdog</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/13/sports/olympics/mens-hockey-canada.html</link><description>Canada has won the past two Olympic men’s hockey tournaments, but with no N.H.L. stars available, the country’s depth of talent will be tested.</description><author>By CURTIS RUSH</author><pubDate>Tue, 13 Feb 2018 22:00:14 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Trudeau to Meet With Family of Fatally Shot Cree Man</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/12/world/canada/saskatchewan-murder-indigenous.html</link><description>Indigenous leaders and supporters across Canada have expressed anger and disbelief over the acquittal of the man who killed Colten Boushie.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 18:11:28 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>He Fought for Iran’s Environment and Was Arrested. Now, He’s Dead.</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/10/world/middleeast/iran-environmentalist-dead-prison.html</link><description>Authorities say a well-known Iranian-Canadian professor killed himself in a Tehran prison, after he and other environmentalists are arrested. His family is demanding answers.</description><author>By THOMAS ERDBRINK</author><pubDate>Sat, 10 Feb 2018 20:01:34 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Tragedy for a Residential School Survivor, and the ‘Real’ Olympics Begin: The Canada Letter</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/09/world/canada/residential-school-survivor-boushie-winter-olympics-canada-letter.html</link><description>This week’s Canada Letter looks at a murder case that has divided Saskatchewan and previews The Times’s Winter Olympics coverage.</description><author>By IAN AUSTEN</author><pubDate>Sat, 10 Feb 2018 00:56:46 GMT</pubDate></item><item><title>Trump Trade Measures Set Off a Global Legal Pushback</title><link>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/09/us/politics/trump-trade.html</link><description>Foreign countries are responding to tariffs imposed on solar panels and washing machines with challenges in American courts and at the World Trade Organization.</description><author>By ANA SWANSON</author><pubDate>Fri, 09 Feb 2018 23:41:12 GMT</pubDate></item></channel></rss>
